title: Can my received alimony payments be garnished for mortgage and credit card debt in California?
question: I'm being held responsible for mortgage and credit card debt. My ex husband has filed bankruptcy for both. Mortgage was taken out in both names, he was cosigner for my credit card.
answers: If you deposit your alimony money in your bank, a creditor having a money judgment against you can satisfy that judgment by levying on your assets, including bank accounts. Mortgage lenders are going to foreclose on the real estate securing the debt, so they will not be able to get a money judgment against you. They prefer to get the property back instead.
